courses.description: SS2 Mathematics course covering algebra, logarithms, sequences, and geometry.

lessons.description: Solving simultaneous linear and quadratic equations.
lessons.textContent: This lesson covers methods for solving simultaneous equations, including one linear and one quadratic equation. Students will learn substitution and elimination methods.

lessons.description: Logarithms of numbers greater than and less than one.
lessons.textContent: This lesson delves into logarithms, covering the characteristics of logarithms for numbers greater than and less than one, and their use in calculations.

lessons.description: Introduction to Arithmetic Progression (AP) and Geometric Progression (GP).
lessons.textContent: This lesson introduces sequences and series, with a focus on Arithmetic Progression (AP) and Geometric Progression (GP), including finding the nth term and the sum of terms.

lessons.description: Understanding and applying circle theorems.
lessons.textContent: This lesson covers the main circle theorems, such as the angle at the center is twice the angle at the circumference, and angles in the same segment are equal.

lessons.description: Derivation and application of the sine and cosine rules.
lessons.textContent: This lesson covers the derivation and application of the sine and cosine rules for solving non-right-angled triangles.

courses.description: SS2 English Language course focusing on grammar, vocabulary, writing, and speech.

lessons.description: Understanding relative and demonstrative pronouns.
lessons.textContent: This lesson focuses on the use of relative and demonstrative pronouns in sentences, and how they connect clauses and specify nouns.

lessons.description: Learning words associated with health.
lessons.textContent: This lesson expands vocabulary with words related to health, such as 'diagnosis', 'prognosis', and 'ailment'.

lessons.description: Learning to write expository essays.
lessons.textContent: This lesson teaches the structure and style of expository essays, which are meant to explain or inform the reader about a topic.

lessons.description: Reading for implied meaning and identifying topic sentences.
lessons.textContent: This lesson focuses on advanced reading comprehension skills, such as reading for implied meaning and identifying the topic sentence of a paragraph.

lessons.description: Learning how to propose and respond to toasts.
lessons.textContent: This lesson covers the social skill of making toasts, including what to say and how to say it in different social situations.

courses.description: SS2 Civic Education covering citizenship, national identity, and human rights.

lessons.description: Duties and obligations of citizens.
lessons.textContent: This lesson focuses on the duties and obligations of citizens in Nigeria, and the skills needed to promote traditions, customs, and beliefs.

lessons.description: Understanding national consciousness, integrity, and unity.
lessons.textContent: This lesson explores the concepts of national consciousness, integrity, and unity, and the factors that promote or hinder them.

lessons.description: The role of political parties and the dangers of political apathy.
lessons.textContent: This lesson discusses the role of political parties in a democracy, how they compete for power through elections, and the dangers of political apathy.

lessons.description: Categories and limitations of human rights.
lessons.textContent: This lesson covers the different categories of human rights (civic, political, economic, social, environmental) and the limitations that can be placed on them.

lessons.description: Understanding the concept and importance of responsible parenthood.
lessons.textContent: This lesson discusses the concept of responsible parenthood and its importance for the well-being of the family and society.

courses.description: SS2 Economics covering demand and supply, production, cost, and market structures.

lessons.description: Analyzing changes in demand and supply and their elasticity.
lessons.textContent: This lesson analyzes the factors that cause changes in demand and supply, and introduces the concept of elasticity of demand and supply.

lessons.description: Understanding the production possibility curve.
lessons.textContent: This lesson explains the concept of the production possibility curve and what it illustrates about scarcity, choice, and opportunity cost.

lessons.description: Understanding the concepts of cost and revenue.
lessons.textContent: This lesson introduces the theory of cost (fixed, variable, total, average, marginal) and revenue (total, average, marginal).

lessons.description: Distinguishing between perfect and imperfect markets.
lessons.textContent: This lesson distinguishes between perfect and imperfect markets, including monopoly and duopoly, and examines how price and quantity are determined in each.

lessons.description: Elements of national income accounting.
lessons.textContent: This lesson introduces the elements of national income accounting, its uses, and the different methods of calculating it.
